The master's name was Hui Ji, and he was the son of the Ye family of Huai Hua in Shao Zhou.
At the age of nine, he left home to study under Chan Master Tong at He An Temple in Guang Zhou. He did not speak to Tong.
At fourteen, his parents took him home and wanted to arrange a marriage for him.

The master did not comply, so he cut off two of his fingers, knelt before his parents, and vowed to seek the true Dharma to repay their kindness. His parents then allowed him to return to Tong's place to become a novice.
Before he had received full ordination, he set out on a pilgrimage.
He first visited Dan Yuan and had already awakened to the profound meaning. Later, he met with He Ze and ascended to the inner chambers.
Dan Yuan said to the master:
The National Teacher transmitted the perfect characteristics of the six generations of ancestral teachers, a total of ninety-seven, to this old monk and said:
'Thirty years after my passing, a novice monk from the south will come and greatly promote this teaching. Pass it on in sequence, do not let it be cut off.
' I now entrust it to you, you should uphold it.
He then passed the text to the master, who, upon receiving it, glanced at it once and then burned it in the fire.
One day, Danyuan asked:
The previous signs should be kept very secret.
The master said:
At that time, after reading it, I burned it.
Danyuan said:
No one can understand this Dharma gate of mine, only my former teacher and the ancestral teachers, as well as the great sages, can fully comprehend it. How could you burn it?
The master said:
Huiji has understood its meaning upon a single glance. It can be used, but one should not cling to the original text.
Danyuan said:
Although it is so, you may understand it, but later people will not be able to believe it.ğŸ”½The master said:
Yes.
If the master wants it, it's not difficult to copy it again.
He then compiled another copy and presented it, without any omissions.
Danyuan said:
Yes.
Danyuan ascended the hall, and the master came out from the assembly, drew a circle, presented it with his hands, and stood with his hands clasped.
Danyuan crossed his hands to form a fist and showed it to him. The master took three steps forward and bowed like a woman.
Danyuan nodded, and the master immediately bowed.
The master was washing his robe, and Danyuan said:
What about right now?
The master said:
Right now, where do you see it?
Later he visited Guishan. Guishan asked:
Are you a shami with a master,
or a shami without a master?
The master said:
With a master.
Guishan said:
Where is your master?
The master went from west to east and stood there.
Guishan found it unusual.
The master asked:
What is the true abode of the Buddha?
Yantou said:

With the wondrousness of non-thought, reversely contemplate the endless spiritual flame. When thought is exhausted and returns to the source, the nature and characteristics are eternally abiding. Phenomena and principle are non-dual, the true Buddha is thus.
The master suddenly awakened to the meaning of these words. From then on, he served Yantou for fifteen years.
Once, as the master was sweeping the ground, Yantou asked:
Dust is not to be swept away, emptiness does not arise by itself.
How is it that dust is not to be swept away?
The master swept the ground once.
Yantou said:
How is it that emptiness does not arise by itself?
The master pointed to himself and then to Yantou.
Yantou said:
Dust is not to be swept away, emptiness does not arise by itself.
Apart from these two approaches, how is it?
The master swept the ground once again, and then pointed to himself and Yantou.
One day, Baizhang pointed to the field and asked Master Shi:
Which end of this field is high and which end is low?
Master Shi said:
The end over there is high and the end over here is low.
Baizhang said:
If you don't believe it, stand in the middle and look at both ends.
Master Shi said:
There's no need to stand in the middle, nor should you stay at either end.
Baizhang said:
If so, look at the water. Water can level things.
Master Shi said:
Water also has no fixed position. It is high where it is high and low where it is low.
Baizhang then stopped.
A donor brought silk to offer to Baizhang.
Master Shi asked:
The donor has offered such food and drink to the master. How should we repay him?
Baizhang tapped the meditation bench to show him.
Master Shi said:
Why does the master use the belongings of the assembly for his own use?
Touzi said, The cypress tree in the garden.ğŸ”½Zhaozhou said, Why turn the Ancestor into a tree?ğŸ”½Touzi said, I didn't say it was a tree.ğŸ”½Zhaozhou said, What is it then?
Touzi said, The Ancestor.
Zhaozhou said, Why say it is a tree?
Touzi said, I didn't say it was a tree.
Zhaozhou said, Why then say it is the Ancestor?
Touzi said, I didn't say it is the Ancestor.
Zhaozhou said, What is it then?
Touzi said, The Ancestor.
Zhaozhou bowed.ğŸ”½Touzi said, Why do you bow?
Zhaozhou said, Because of the Ancestor.
Touzi said, You are a good student.
Zhaozhou then left.ğŸ”½Touzi said, This student is a good student.
You have not seen that when the Great Master Bodhidharma came from the Western Heaven to this land, he also brought this thing to present to people.
All of you are those who have received his trust and gifts.
The master, while working as the head of the kitchen at Mount Xuedou, returned.
Mount Xuedou asked:
Where did you come from?
The master said:
From the fields.
Mount Xuedou said:
How many people are there in the fields?
The master inserted his hoe and put his hands together.
Mount Xuedou said:
Today there are many people harvesting thatch on South Mountain.
The master pulled out his hoe and left.
Xuan Sha Bei said:
If I saw it, I would kick over the hoe.
A monk asked Jing Qing:
What is the meaning of Master Yangshan inserting his hoe?
Jing Qing said:
The imperial pardon is like a dog's tail, and the feudal lords avoid the road.
The monk said:
What is the meaning of Master Xuansha kicking it over?
Jing Qing said:
The boat is not to be blamed, it's the dipper that's broken.
The monk said:
What is the meaning of 'South Mountain is cutting thatch'?
Jingqing said:
Li Jing's three older brothers have long been in the battle formations.
Yunju Xi said:
Tell me, did Jingqing's judgment hit the mark or not?
Xuedou Xian said:
All the other places consider the story of the hoe being inserted to be extraordinary, but it's just like following evil and pursuing wickedness.
According to Xuedou's view, when Yangshan was asked by Guishan, he was immediately bound by grass ropes and died completely.
Cuifeng Zhi said:
Yangshan only got one part. Do any of you understand differently?
When the master was herding oxen for Guishan, Tiantai questioned him, saying:
I won't ask about a single lion appearing on the tip of a hair;
How about billions of lions appearing on the tip of a hair?
The master then rode the ox back.
While standing by Yantou's side, he brought up the previous story just as he finished, he saw Tai come.
The master said:
It's just this person here.
Yantou then asked:
Didn't you say that a hundred koá¹­is of lion kings appear on a single hair?
Tai said:
Yes.
The master said:
When they are appearing, do they appear in front of the hair or behind the hair?
Tai said:
When they are appearing, I don't speak of front or back.
Yantou laughed loudly.
The master said:
The lion's waist is broken.
He then left.

The master followed Yantou on a mountain excursion, sitting on a flat rock. While standing by his side, a crow suddenly picked up a red persimmon and dropped it in front of them. Yantou picked it up and gave it to the master.
The master took it, washed it, and offered it to Yantou.
Yantou said:
Where did you get this?
The master said:
This is what the abbot's virtue and conduct have inspired.
Mt. Xuedou said:
You should not be without a share.
He then divided it in half and gave it to the master.
Xuan Sha said:
The great Mt. Xuedou was sat on by Yangshan and has not been able to get up until now.
Mt. Xuedou asked the master:
If someone were to ask you, how would you respond?
The master said:
If my uncle Dongsi were here, I would not be so lonely.
Mt. Xuedou said:
I let you off with one offense of not responding.
The master said:
Giving life and taking it away are all in one word.
Mt. Xuedou said:
I do not begrudge you seeing it, but there is another person who will not agree.
The master said:
Who is it?
Mt. Xuedou pointed to a pillar and said:
This one.
The master said:
What does it say?
Mt. Xuedou said:
What is it?
The master said:
The white rat pushes and changes, the silver platform remains unchanged.
The master asked Zhaozhou:
When the great function is manifested, please, master, distinguish it.
Zhaozhou went down from the high seat and returned to his room. The master followed him.
Zhaozhou asked:
What was the question you just asked?
The master repeated it.
Zhaozhou said:
Do you still remember my answer?
The master said:
I remember.
Zhaozhou said:
Try to repeat it.
The master then took his leave.
Zhaozhou said:
Wrong.
The master turned his head and said:
If my younger brother Xixian comes, don't tell him I have no words.
The master was herding an ox on the front slope of Mt. Xichan. He saw a monk coming up the mountain, but soon coming down again.
The master asked:
Why didn't you stay in the mountain, Venerable?
The monk said:
It's just that the circumstances did not match.
The master said:
What circumstances?
Try bringing them up.
The monk said:
The master asked me what my name is, and I answered 'Returning to the Truth.'
The master said:
'Where does Returning to the Truth reside?'
I had no response.
The master said:
Go back and tell the master:
'I can say it.'
If the master asks:
'How do you say it?'
Just say:
'In the eyes, ears, and nose.'
The monk returned and relayed it as instructed.
Mt. Xuedou said:
This is the speech of a teacher of five hundred people.
The master was lying down when he dreamed he entered the inner courtyard of Maitreya, in the main hall, all the positions were filled, only the second position was empty, the master then sat down.
An elder said, striking the gavel:ğŸ”½
An elder said, Now the second seat will speak the Dharma.
The master rose and said, The MahÄyÄna Dharma is beyond the four propositions and a hundred negations. Listen carefully, listen carefully.
The assembly all dispersed.
When he woke up, he told it to Guishan, who said,
You have already entered the holy ranks.
The master then bowed.
Guishan Xiu said,
If you explain the text according to the meaning, it is not without.
Suddenly, in Maitreya's assembly, there is a capable one who, upon seeing him say 'MahÄyÄna Dharma,' would say,
'Take away both pieces of skin.'
Not only does this stop Yangshan's dream talk, it also prevents later people from speaking dreams within a dream.
Langya Jiao said,
Tell me, did the holy assembly agree with Yangshan or not agree with Yangshan?
If they agreed, then they let Yangshan down;
if they didn't agree, then Yangshan was like someone eating a meal on flat ground.
I, the mountain monk, today do not spare my eyebrows, and will explain it for you all:
The MahÄyÄna Dharma is beyond the four propositions and transcends the hundred negations.
If you bring it up to others, and others understand it like this, it is like shooting an arrow into hell.
Dongchan Guan said:

The Venerable struck the gavel, and the holy assembly immediately dispersed, which is enough to make people doubt. Only after being splashed with the second ladle of foul water did they finally become alert, but it was already too late.
As for the MahÄyÄna Dharma being beyond the four propositions and transcending the hundred negations, it has already been explained. Do you all recognize Yangshan?
The master was accompanying Master Wensui on a walk when they suddenly saw dust rising in front of them.
Master Wensui said:
What is it in front?
The master went forward to look, then made this mudra. Master Wensui nodded.
Master Wensui once said to the assembly:
All sentient beings are devoid of buddha-nature.
Yancong of Guangguo Temple once said to the assembly:
All sentient beings possess Buddha-nature.
Two monks from Yangguan went to investigate. When they arrived at Nanyue, they heard Nanyue expound the Dharma, but they could not fathom its limits, and so they gave rise to contempt.
One day, as they were conversing with Shi, they encouraged him, saying:
Brother, you must diligently study the Buddha-dharma, do not take it lightly.
Shi then made this circle shape with his hand, presented it, and then threw it behind his back. He then extended both hands to the two monks, asking for something.
The two monks were at a loss.
Shi said:
Brother, you must diligently study the Buddha-dharma, do not take it lightly.
He then got up and left.
At that time, the two monks returned to Yangguan. After walking thirty li, one of the monks suddenly had an insight and said:
I now know that Nanyue said, 'All sentient beings are devoid of Buddha-nature,' and I believe it is not wrong.
He then returned to Nanyue.
A monk went ahead for several more li, and while crossing a stream, he suddenly had an insight. He sighed and said:
Yantou said, 'All sentient beings are without Buddha-nature,' and indeed he said it like this.
He also returned to Yantou's place and stayed in his assembly for a long time.
At Yan Tou's assembly, there were several people who would not submit to Yantou.

One day, during a general work period, they were carrying rice at the western estate. When Yantou reached the top of the ridge, he put down his load, and then ten or so people also put down their loads.
Yantou then picked up the rice basket, walked around in front of the people, and said:ğŸ”½Is there anyone?
Is there anyone?
But none of the monks had anything to say.
Yantou said:
You're killing me!
And then he carried the rice away.
Once, Yantou and Yanguan were herding cows together. Yantou said:
Are there any bodhisattvas here?
Yanguan said:
There are.
Yantou said:ğŸ”½Where?
You see which one is it, try to point it out.
The master said:
The master doubts which one is not it, try to point it out.
Guishan then stopped.
The master sent some fruit to Guishan, who received it and asked:
Where did you get this?
The master said:
From the family garden.
Guishan said:
Is it edible yet?
The master said:
I dare not taste it myself, I first offer it to the master.
Guishan said:
Whose is it?
The master said:ğŸ”½Huiji's.
Guishan said:
Since it's yours, why do you tell me to taste it first?
The master said:
The master has tasted a thousand and tasted ten thousand.
Guishan then ate it and said:
It still has a sour and astringent taste.
The master said:
Sour and astringent, isn't it known by yourself?
Mazu did not answer.
Later, during the summer retreat, Yangshan went to pay respects to Mazu. Mazu said:
You haven't come up all summer, what have you been doing down there?
Yangshan said:
I've been plowing a field and planting a basket of seeds down there.
Mazu said:
You haven't wasted this summer.
Yangshan then asked:
I wonder what the master has been doing this summer?
Mazu said:
Eating one meal a day and sleeping at night.
Yangshan said:
The master hasn't wasted this summer either.
Having said this, he stuck out his tongue.
Mazu said:
Why do you injure yourself like this, Yangshan?
Guishan Lingyou said:
Yangshan's eyes illuminate the four directions, but when he got in front of Great Mirror, he was defeated on level ground.
Great Mirror can be said to have provided the conditions for raising his son, but he couldn't avoid hanging it on the lips and teeth of later generations.
Longmen Yuan said:
When the father and son of the Wuzhu lineage usually meet, they play with spiritual powers, not just a little bit. Is there anyone who knows?
If not, I will tell you all.
He opened up a piece of field, tight and compact, and with two meals of gruel and rice, his way was naturally accomplished.
This summer I have met with you all, but you have not understood.
If you understand, it becomes a whole piece. What is this whole piece?
Look at the arrow at the gate.
Xichan Rui said:
The father and son of the Wuzhu lineage come and go, rolling up and unfolding, freely and at ease. You all must not discuss it in worldly terms, nor understand it as Buddhist principles.
Since it is not allowed to discuss it in either way, how can it be understood after all?
I've cleared a patch of land and planted a basket of rice. Turning my head, I leisurely gaze - the mountains are green and the water is also green.
All day I eat only one meal, at night I sleep only once. When tired, I sleep on my side, with a thousand feet and ten thousand feet.
Together we'll come in August and September, and the yellow chrysanthemums will be in full bloom by the fence.
Donglin Yan said:
Nowadays, a thousand or a hundred monks gather in groups, wasting the winter and summer in vain, deeply disgracing the ancients.
Donglin is not picking on the sages, but Yangshan is too ostentatious, only showing half by sticking out his tongue.
One day, as Yangshan was coming, Baizhang crossed his hands, each rubbing three times, then raised one finger.
Yangshan also crossed his hands, each rubbing three times, then faced his chest, one hand raised, one hand covering, and looked with his eyes.
Baizhang then left.
When Baizhang was feeding the birds with rice, he turned his head and saw Master Yaoshan. He said:
Today I gave a lecture for him.
Master Yaoshan said:
I also got to hear it by chance.
Baizhang said:
What is the matter you heard?
Master Yaoshan said:
The crows caw, the magpies chirp.
Baizhang said:
How can you avoid form and sound?
Master Yaoshan said:
What did you just say, Master?
Baizhang said:
I just said I gave a lecture for him.
Master Yaoshan said:
Why do you call it form and sound?
Baizhang said:
Even so, it's not without verification.
Master Yaoshan said:
How do you verify the great matter?
Baizhang raised his fist.
Master Yaoshan said:
You're still pointing east and drawing west.
Baizhang said:
What did you just ask?
The master said:
I asked the master about the great matter of causes and conditions.
Guishan said:
Why do you call it pointing to the east and drawing the west?
The master said:
Because of being attached to sounds and forms, I asked about it.
Guishan said:
You have not yet understood this matter.
The master said:
How can I understand this matter?
Guishan said:
Ji's sounds and forms, the old monk's east and west.
The master said:
The moon in a thousand rivers, its essence is not divided by the water.
Guishan said:
It should be like this.
The master said:
Like gold and gold, it has no different colors, how can it have different names?
Guishan said:
What is the principle of having no different names?
The master said:
Bottles, dishes, hairpins, bracelets, promissory notes, bowls, and basins.
Wenshu said:
Jizi's Chan is like a lion's roar, which startles and scatters the foxes, wolves, and wild animals.
One day, the master was attending Wenshu. Suddenly, they heard a bird singing. Wenshu said:
It speaks of things that go straight to the point.
The master said:
You can't tell others about this.
Wenshu said:
Why do you say that?
The master said:
Because it speaks too straightforwardly.
Wenshu said:
How many Dharma gates did Jizi just push down?
The master said:
How is it to push down things?
Wenshu knocked the meditation seat three times.
The master stayed at Wangmang Mountain. When he returned to pay respects, Wenshu asked:

Since you are called a good teacher, how can you discern whether those who come from various places know or do not know, have a teacher or do not have a teacher, are studying doctrine or are studying the profound?
Try to explain it.
The master said:
I have a way to test people.
Whenever I see a monk coming, I raise my whisk and ask him:
'Do they talk about this in other places or not?
' And I say:
'Let's put this aside for now, what do the old masters of other places think?'
Mount Tiantai sighed and said:
This is the tooth and nail of the ancestral gate from the past.
Mount Tiantai also asked:
The karmic consciousness of sentient beings on this great earth is vast and has no basis to rely on. How can you know whether they have it or not?
The master said:
I have a way to test people.
At that time, a monk passed in front of him. The master called out:
Venerable monk!
The monk turned his head.
The master said:
Venerable!
This is precisely the vastness of karmic consciousness, with no basis to rely on.
Wenshan said:
This is a drop of the lion's milk that shatters six bushels of donkey milk.
The master asked Shuangfeng:
What have you seen recently, younger brother?
He said:
According to my understanding, there is indeed not a single dharma that can correspond to the mind.
The master said:
Your understanding is still within the realm.
He said:
I am just like this, but how about you, elder brother?
The master said:
How could you not know?
There is not a single dharma that can correspond to the mind.
Wenshan heard this and said:
Jizi's single statement will doubt everyone in the world.
Xuanjue said:

The sutra says, 'There is no dharma that the Buddha gave me the prediction,' and others say, 'There is not a single dharma that can correspond to the mind,' why is it said, 'Understanding is still within the realm'?
Where is the danger?
One day during the rain, Tianxing said to the master:
What good rain!
The master said:
Where is the goodness?
Tianxing had no words.
The master said:ğŸ”½I can say it.
Tianxing said:
Where is the goodness?
The master pointed to the rain, and Tianxing again had no words.
The master said:
How can you be greatly wise and silent?
One day, the first seat raised his whisk and said:
If someone can understand the principle, I will give it to him.
The master said:
Can I have it if I understand the principle?
The seat said:
Just do it in a way that makes sense.
The master then snatched away the whisk.
Yunju Xi said:
Where is the principle in Yangshan's words?
The layman Pang asked:
I've long admired Mount Yang, but when I arrive, why is it overturned?
The master raised his whisk. The layman said:
That's right.
The master said:
Is it Yang?
Is it overturned?
The layman then hit the pillar, saying:
Even though there's no one here, I still want the pillar to bear witness.
The master threw down the whisk, saying:
When you get to other places, feel free to bring this up.
Yinzong Cen said:
The great Shakyamuni was pushed by the layman Pang and became flustered and confused. As for the layman hitting the pillar once, what about that?
The whale swallows the ocean water dry, revealing the coral branches.
The Three Sages came to visit. The master asked:
What is your name?
The Three Sages said:
Huiji.
The master said:
Huiji is my name.
The Three Sages said:
My name is Huiran.
The master laughed loudly.
An official visited the master. The master asked:
What position do you hold?
The official said:
I'm a prosecuting attorney.
The master raised his whisk and said:
Can you prosecute this?
The official had no reply.
The master had the assembly say something, but none of them understood.
At that time, the Three Sages were not feeling well and were resting in the Nirvana Hall.
The master ordered an attendant to go and ask them to say something.
The Three Sages said:
Just say the master has something to do today.
The master again ordered the attendant to ask:
What is the matter?
The Three Sages said:
A second offense will not be tolerated.
Chan Master Guangyong of Nantou went north to visit Linji and then returned to serve the master.
The master said:
What are you doing here?
Nantou said:
To pay respects to the master.
The master said:
Do you see the master?
Nantou said:
I see him.
The master said:
What does the master look like?
Nantou said:
I see the master as not resembling a buddha.
The master said:
If he doesn't resemble a buddha, what does he resemble?
Nantou said:
If there is something he resembles, what is the difference from a donkey?
The master was greatly surprised and said:
When both the ordinary and the sacred are forgotten, the essence manifests.
I have used this to test people for twenty years, and no one has been able to decisively understand it. You should preserve and uphold it.
The master often said to people:
This child is a flesh-and-blood buddha.
When Huoshan came to visit, the master sat with eyes closed.
Huoshan then raised his right foot and said:
Thus it is, thus it is. The twenty-eight Indian patriarchs were also thus, the six Chinese patriarchs were also thus, the master is also thus, and Jingtong is also thus.
The master got up and hit him with four switches. Huoshan then called himself the great Chan master under Zhuming Peak who was hit with four switches.
When the practitioner Chigan heard the bell sound, he asked:ğŸ”½Is it the eared one ringing the bell?
Or is it the eared one ringing the bell?
The master said:
You just ask, don't worry that I can't answer.
The practitioner said:
I've already asked.
The master shouted:
Go away.
Liu, the Chamberlain for Ceremonials, asked:
Can I hear the principle of understanding the mind?
The master said:
If you want to understand the mind, there is no mind to be understood;
A mind without understanding is true understanding.
Official Lu Xisheng wanted to visit the master and first sealed this circle and presented it.
The master opened the seal and wrote below the circle:
Not thinking and yet knowing falls into the second head;
Thinking and then knowing falls into the third head.
He then sealed it back.
The official saw it and immediately entered the mountain. The master welcomed him at the gate.
As soon as the official entered the gate, he asked:
All three gates are open, from which gate do you enter?
The master said:
Enter through the gate of faith.
When the official arrived at the Dharma hall, he asked again:
When leaving the realm of demons and entering the realm of buddhas, what is it like?
The master pointed with his whisk three times upside down, and the official immediately bowed.
He asked again:
Do you still uphold the precepts, master?
The master said:
I do not uphold the precepts.
He said:
Do you still sit in meditation?
The master said:
Not sitting in meditation.
The official was silent for a long time.
The master said:
Do you understand?
He said:
I don't understand.
The master said:
Listen to this verse from this old monk:
Flowing, not upholding precepts; still, not sitting in meditation; three or two cups of strong tea; the meaning is in the handle of the hoe.
The master then asked:
I've heard that the official has attained awakening by reading the sutras, is that so?
He said:
As a disciple, I was reading the Nirvana Sutra and it says 'not cutting off afflictions while entering nirvana,' and I attained a state of bliss.
The master raised his whisk and said:
What about entering this?
He said:
The word 'entering' is not necessary.
The master said:
The word 'entering' is not for the official.
The official then left.
Fadeng said:
Elder!
Just tell me, for whose sake is this one word 'enter'?
He also said:
You, Prime Minister, should not be troubled.
Xuedou Xian, at the point where Yangshan raised his whisk, said differently:
The whisk is in my hand.
And he said differently after [the monk's] later words:
I thought you were a worldly person.
The master, because Wei Zhou requested a gÄthÄ from Guishan,
Guishan said:
Even if it is presented face to face, it is still for a slow-witted person, let alone written on paper and ink?
Wei then requested it from the master.
The master drew a circle on paper and annotated it, saying:
If you think about it and know it, you fall into the second head;
If you do not think about it and know it, you fall into the third head.ğŸ”½When the master was a novice, Huinan Tong one day called the master, saying, Bring the bed here.
The master brought it, and Huinan said:
Put it back where it was.

The master's skillful responses in guiding people became the standard for the Chan gate. He moved again to Dongping. When he was about to pass away, several monks were standing by. The master showed them a verse, saying:
One, two, two, three, open the eyes and look up, two mouths, one without a tongue, this is the purport of our school.
At noon on the day, he ascended the seat to bid farewell to the assembly. He again spoke a verse, saying:
My age is seventy-seven, impermanence is here today, the sun is right at noon, I clasp my knees with both hands.
After saying this, he clasped his knees with both hands and passed away.

The following year, Chan Master Nanta Yong moved the master's relics back to Mount Yang and enshrined them under Jiyun Peak, bestowing the posthumous name Chan Master Zhi Tong, the Pagoda of Wonderful Light.
